snippet: Most “rugged devices,” those designed to tolerate being outdoors on a regular basis, run Microsoft’s older Windows Mobile operating system, and it’s questionable how long the software giant can fend off competitors.
abstract: Most “rugged devices,” those designed to tolerate being outdoors on a regular basis, run Microsoft’s older Windows Mobile operating system, and it’s questionable how long the software giant can fend off competitors.

headline.main: How Microsoft Could Lose Its Grip on 'Rugged' Devices
